Component: Colors

Introduction

The colors represented below are considered approved for usage throughout the website. All of these variables can be overridden on a situational basis because they all have !default appended to it. This means that you can continue to use the color variables by name as listed here, but update their value to whatever you'd like for your feature.

An example of this would be the /energy section of tesla.com. They are using a different color blue than the $tesla-transactional as listed below. The team is able use the correct color for blue but still use the correct variable. This makes it easy to update the colors across the system easily and simply without a lot of extra work.

Primary Colors

$tesla-primary
$tesla-active
$tesla-transactional

Grey Scale Colors

$black
$grey-1
$grey-2
$grey-3
$grey-4
$grey-6
$grey-8
$grey-9
$grey-a
$grey-b
$grey-c
$grey-d
$grey-e
$white

Background Colors

$grey-background-color
$grey-background-color-light
$grey-background-color-lightest
$grey-background-color-even-lighterest

Extra Colors

$border-footer
$form-label-color
$border-content
$ui-text
